The Omani side was chaired at the session by Dr Rawya bint Saud al Busaidiya, Higher Education Minister, while the Palestinian side was chaired by Lamis Mustafa al Alami, Education and Higher Education Minister. The session discussed the possibility of student and academic exchanges between the higher education institutions in the two countries and exchanging educational curricula. The meeting also discussed the possibility loaning of professors for one academic year or more for training in presented disciplines (information technology, engineering, design and business management) at applied sciences colleges, in addition to discussing the implementation of research programmes and joint scientific forums. Details, P4 Weather alert MUSCAT — The Directorate-General of Meteorology and Air Navigation, Ministry of Transport and Communications, has said that numeric predication charts and updated data indicate that the waves will be very high in the Sea of Oman and the western coast of Musandam Governorate due to strong winds in the area. The phenomenon, which started yesterday evening, will continue till Thursday. The Met office hereby urges all fishermen and other seafarers to take full precaution before venturing out. The northwesterly winds are expected to cause gradual decline in temperatures over the next three days, particularly in mountainous areas and the desert with chances of dust overcasting the skies in some areas. — ONA progressing and will be ready in three or four months. The bridge, initiated by the Muscat Municipality as part of its seven projects focusing on beautifying the capital city, is 151.3 metres in length and the rest will be occupied by ramps on both sides. Several arches, curves and other additional works make this pedestrian bridge different from others in the region. The project began in Sep- tember 2011 and is expected to be completed by April-May this year. Also called Architectural Bridge by experts for its architectural forte, this 166.1-metre-long, with width rang- ing from 7 to 7.5 at different places, this bridge comprises 7 spans ranging from 20 to 38 metres in-between and 8 piers to support it. Each span will be different from the other. This bridge will mainly help people to commute between these two areas without wading through the wadi in times of rains. There are multitude of features that makes the project a cut above the rest. The conference was presided over by Darwish bin Ismaeel al Balushi, Minister Responsible for Financial Affairs. See P28 Ekaterina stuns Serena THE Australian Open women’s draw was thrown wide open yesterday after Russia’s Ekaterina Makarova shocked Serena Williams in the fourth round, as Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova won in straight sets. Makarova, the world number 56, reached a grand slam quarter-final for the first time when she stunned a below-par Williams 6-2, 6-3. Sultanate hailed for global relief MUSCAT — Valerie Amos, United Nations Under-Secretary General for Humanitarian Affairs and Emergency Relief Co-ordinator, is on a mission to strengthen the Sultanate’s multinational humanitarian partnership with Organisation for Charity and Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA). In a press briefing held yesterday at the Crowne Plaza Hotel, the diplomat said: “Oman has been increasingly playing an important role on international scale to support the humanitarian affairs through the Oman Charitable Organisation (OCO). “The Sultanate has also committed a lot of effort to build a strong national capacity to respond to natural disasters and shown its commitment to disaster preparedness through a comprehensive reorganisation of its disaster management and emergency response systems,” she noted. The Sultanate has a wealth of experience to share with the international community, and OCHA is ready to support and facilitate any such exchange of information and knowledge,” she said.
